intro: Ceratosanthes corniculata, commonly known as the horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its distinctive, horn-like seed pods that give it its common name. The plant produces showy, bright orange to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and riverbanks. The species is part of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other poppy species.
